Key Match Events: Brandon Pfaadt struggled after the first inning, allowing multiple runs in the second and fifth innings due to defensive errors and untimely hitting.
Jordan Montgomery made his debut out of the bullpen, facing a bases-loaded scenario but later settling down and pitching effectively.
Diamondbacks avoided a shutout in the 7th inning with a solo homer and a two-run home run.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Torey Lovullo mentioned the Diamondbacks beating themselves with defensive miscues and untimely hitting.
Pfaadt discussed his command issues and the mistakes that led to the loss.
Lovullo praised Montgomery for adjusting after a rough start and effectively pitching in relief.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the second of a series between the Diamondbacks and Mets.
Diamondbacks pitcher Brandon Pfaadt had a rough outing, his worst in his last six starts.
Montgomery, in his first relief appearance, faced a challenging scenario but managed to stabilize the bullpen.
